title: What champions can you be banned for; by playing them as support?
body:
This is an actual serious; non troll post. I was informed if you choose a champion that doesn't fit the current meta you can be banned (Support Team has actually confirmed this).

As a Brand support main; I'm wondering how this works. I manage to get S grade almost every game, and do very well for my team. Yet I'm finding people calling me a "Troll"/reporting me for choosing that champion as it's non traditional. It's very viable to bring a burst mage bot lane (Annie/Brand/Zyra) for kill lanes - I'm wondering how that translates to other champions. 

I see a lot of break the meta videos and they show insane combinations that actually work. Question is - is there a list of champions your allowed to play support? I'd hate to be punished for trying something new in normals.

In all honesty, none. Picking any champ for any role is not a reportable offence unless you are intentionally griefing your team. you could use {{champion:11}} support and so long as it's not in spite of your team and you are legitimately trying to play him as a support, you really haven't done anything wrong. Now, WILL you get reported for picking a champ that isn't viable as a support for the support role? Without question. If by some chance your team doesn't automatically think you are trolling them and report you, you will still likely have them flaming you for the whole match for picking a bad support.
When it comes to what works as a support and what doesn't, it's mostly about utility, CC and how necessary it is for that champ to farm. {{champion:1}}, {{champion:63}} and{{champion:143}} all work as supports cause they have CC in some form and don't necessarily need to farm to do well. 
Supports like them gradually poke down the enemy and try to CC the them so the ADC can land the kill. champs like {{champion:114}} or {{champion:23}} rely on farming and kills to do well, so they don't tend to make for good supports, while {{champion:99}} can get {{item:3092}} and {{item:3041}} and do very well for herself even without any minions.

The main things to keep in mind  about what champs can support is: 

* does this champ have any utility/CC to speak of (outside of items)
* Will this champ help the ADC in lane or will it just get in the way?
* can this champ get away no farm and an extremely cheap build?
(ex. {{item:3092}} {{item:3050}} {{item:3222}} {{item:2045}} {{item:3041}} {{item:3158}} )

You can't be banned for picking non-meta champions.

Honestly, I've play with Katarina and Talon supports as the ADC quite happily.  I don't really care who they pick so long as they play according by:

* Build Sightstone
* Letting me last hit minions

No one.

In approximately 100% of cases, those claiming to be punished for playing something off meta were actually punished for something else (usually toxicity/trolling). Picking an off-meta support (or off-meta anything) is on it's own is not trolling, and with very few exceptions (off the top of my head, kat, yi, and lucian), every champ offers some sort of potential utility that could be support-y, and even the exceptions I mentioned earlier could be as snowbally kill lane type supports.

That said, while playing an off-meta support is not itself trolling, it's not a license to troll under the guise of trying something off-meta. It's not terribly difficult to tell the difference between someone genuinely trying something off meta, and someone trying to troll in a manner they think they can get away with. If such a 'secret troll' actually played their off meta pick while communicating as best they can and trying their best to win, then that'd actually be fine and they would get away with it, but in practice it tends to be far more toxic chatter and bait-y stuff, and *thats* what players are punished for, not the pick itself.

Well, where is the line between "off-meta" and "troll"?

Let's say I'm queued as support and I go Jhin. How, exactly, will I support my team? All four of Jhin's abilities have the potential to steal CS, and the kit has very little utility beyond heavy damage. Other than taking kills and CS away from the team, how will a support Jhin get money? Spellthief's Edge?

The same is true for many champs in the game. Many mages can support to an extent, but Vlad, for example, lacks CC and will steal CS. A support Garen offers no peels and only a light silence for utility. Most Marksmen and Assassins are designed to take kills, not set them up for somebody else.

I hate when people want to tell me that supports have no right to get cs or kills. I hate when people call a zed support a troll even if he's doing a good job and almost solo killed the enemy adc and I have no problem if he accidentally steals a few cs because his q is aoe. I don't care if he only playes zed support because he didn't got mid as long as he's trying to win. If you have a problem with the lack of vision because he rushed ghost blade instead of sightstone, you can friendly ask or convince him to build a sightstone or build a sightstone yourself, but you have no right to flame him or to demand that he has to build this item.
Just stop being ignorant, chill down and do the things that give you the highest chance of winning. Just give the zed support a few kill/cs and  watch him being useful.

I'm a support main, I know what we have the "right" to do.

Sure, inevitably, supports get some cs and some kills. Especially when the ADC is out of range, dead, etc. But it's not our primary job. 

That support Zed that you're oddly okay with is attempting to support you as a nerfed assassin. If he can randomly get a kill on their ADC that your team otherwise wouldn't have gotten, okay, great. But he's playing an assassin without farming! That's simply ludicrous. Meanwhile, he can't sustain you beyond whatever Relic Shield is giving, he can't peel, he can't snare. He can only poke, in such a way that may steal CS, and in such a way that likely won't do much damage at all since he's underfed. 

The whole point of Zed is to get fed, snowball, and rapidly eliminate enemy carries. A Zed with 40 CS at 30 minutes, Sightstone, and Relic Shield probably isn't doing that. So what ARE they contributing, exactly?

Case 1: Person picks Jhin support, and the other person either doesn't really care or approves of it, despite flat-out knowing that the game will turn out badly. He is doing for the sake of "fun" and "trying something different", and that someone approves of it. Sure, they'll lose, but no rules are broken. In lane he may feed from failure of dodging skillshots, but afterwards he actually *tries* to stop dying. That's not trolling. In fact, as a support main, I sometimes play anti-CC champs as a support even in One-for-All, even in a team of five Katarinas.

Case 2: Person picks Jhin support, despite his *entire* team telling no otherwise. "OMG I GET TO DO WHATEVER I WANT STFU", or somewhere along the similar the lines of it (it can even be very subtle and calm speech form). What's the reason? It can either be "you took my role", "I just feel like it", anything that promotes "I want to make sure you guys are mad/angry/tilted/whatever". Absolutely no incentives of trying to win, or obvious signs of trying to lose, such as purposely walking in to feed. After lane? AFK, or just giving up. If that's not trolling then I don't know what to say otherwise.

TLDR approval of others and the purpose of playing all matters. Just because something is "off-meta", that doesn't mean it is "troll". Same goes vice-versa, if anything. The difference is based on what the person is trying to accomplish.

These are terrible examples.  Garen is a lane bully / natural tank which is decent for an offensive AD support.  Vladimir has sustain and a trollpool that -is- a slow, he's was sleeper-useful in his pre-rework form.  Not sure about Vlad now, but he used to combo with Jhin.

You're welcome to disagree with me, but do you really think these were "terrible" examples?

Since when is "offensive AD support" a thing? Poking is ideally from as far a range as possible. Garen needs to be in melee to effectively lane-bully, and doesn't close that gap well. He lacks any slowing capability, which means that he doesn't help his ADC engage. As support, he'll be underfed, which makes his potential to bully the lane significantly worse than it might be at Top. And if you go full tanky with him, his offensive impact will be negligible. Tank supports are a thing, of course, but they're usually characterized by CC, gap closers, sustain, etc. Garen has none of that. 

Regarding Vlad, I was referring to his post-rework. Much (most?) of his damage comes from his AoE E ability, which happens to be a great wave clear tool when you're playing him at top, but not exactly something you want a support firing off bot lane.

It's only trolling/griefing if you're intentionally ruining the lane/game for your teammates. Off-meta is off-meta, it can be a really bad idea that gets your lane wrecked without being any form of trolling.

EG: A Tahm that spits you into the enemy team at any chance they get. That's trolling

See, I have to disagree. Some champion kits simply don't have a means of supporting. It's one thing to pick a champ that isn't traditionally support, like Amumu, Kayle, or various other AP poke-mages, with the expectation that you can still fit the support role. But I honestly don't know how somebody could pick Garen support with good intentions.

It could be done, depending on how you play it and who you're up against. There's a lot of things that can be done with the support role, one of which is a Garen meat shield for the ADC (against someone like Ezreal).

Any champion can be played as a support without it being trolling, just like any champion can jungle. Doesn't make it a good or smart pick, but it's not trolling. Although I would be pretty upset if someone took Garen support in ranked, as long as they play the role they called properly I've got no problems with it.

It's been stated by Rioters on several occasions, that you can't be banned for off-meta/unconventional picks (Like tank Akali was at first considered to be trolling). 

I'd definitely say that things like Garen, Jax, or other champs not usually picked in the botlane aren't supports I'd like to have in ranked as I wouldn't have any idea whether or not they'd do well or do badly.

Some of my personal favorites to take as a support, are Kha'zix and Shaco. Definitely not great in the botlane, makes it a lot harder to pull off good plays, but doesn't mean it's not viable nor does it mean the player is trolling.
